page.title: 14SOUTHSEA CHURCHES
page.content: {St Jude's Church }started with the Rev.Owen who suggested to his brother {Thomas Owen}that his houses in South- sea weren't selling because there was no church nearby. Owen built St. Jude's Church in 1815. In 1973 the church was closed for 6months whilst being modernised. The {Temple of Spiritualism }in Southsea began in 1901. In 1938 the building was pulled down and was the only religious building allowed to be finished during the 2nd World War. The Portsmouth {Mosque}is in Marmion Road.They pray everyday, especially on Fridays as this is their holy day. They have nothing in their prayer rooms except prayer mats which face Mecca in Saudi Arabia.Moslems believe there is one God,Allah. They do believe in Jesus but only as a prophet and not the Son of God.
